SEARCH
Package autograd

Class Value

java.lang.Object
autograd.Differentiable
autograd.Value
public class Value extends Differentiable
Represents a node in a computational graph that can perform automatic differentiation. Each node (`Value`) can perform basic arithmetic operations and supports gradient computation necessary for the backpropagation algorithm in neural networks.

  • Field Summary

      Returns the parents of this value in the computational graph.

      An ArrayList of Value instances that are parents of this value.

      Static method to add a list of Value instances, supporting automatic differentiation.
      Parameters:
      values - The list of Value instances to be added.
      Returns:
      A new Value instance representing the sum of the provided values.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the provided list of values is null.

    • pow

      public Value pow(double exponent)
      Raises the value of this Value object to the power of the given exponent. This method computes the power of the current value using the provided exponent, creating a new Value object with the result. It also sets up the backpropagation function necessary for gradient computation during the training phase if requires_grad is true. If requires_grad is set to true, the current Value object is added as a parent of the new Value object to maintain the computation graph for gradient backpropagation.
      Parameters:
      exponent - the exponent to which the current value is to be raised
      Returns:
      a new Value object whose value is this object's value raised to the given exponent
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the exponent causes the result to exceed numerical limits

    • div

      public Value div(Value other)
      Divides this Value object by another Value object. This method performs division by using the reciprocal of the other Value object. It throws an exception if an attempt is made to divide by a null or zero value.
      Parameters:
      other - the Value object by which this object is to be divided
      Returns:
      a new Value object representing the quotient of this object divided by the provided Value
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the other Value object is null
      RuntimeException - if the other Value's value is zero, preventing division

    • div

      public Value div(double constant)
      Divides this Value object by a constant. This method calculates the division of this object's value by the given constant using the reciprocal of that constant. It throws an exception if an attempt is made to divide by zero.
      Parameters:
      constant - the double value by which this Value object is to be divided
      Returns:
      a new Value object representing the quotient of this object's value divided by the given constant
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the constant is zero, as division by zero is undefined

    • relu

      public Value relu()
      Applies the ReLU (Rectified Linear Unit) activation function to this value, supporting automatic differentiation. ReLU function outputs the input itself if it is positive; otherwise, it outputs zero.
      Returns:
      A new Value instance representing the result of the ReLU function.

    • leakyRelu

      public Value leakyRelu()
      Applies the Leaky ReLU activation function to this value, supporting automatic differentiation. Leaky ReLU outputs the input itself if it is positive; otherwise, it outputs the input multiplied by 0.01.
      Returns:
      A new Value instance representing the result of the Leaky ReLU function.

    • log

      public Value log()
      Applies the logarithm function to this value, supporting automatic differentiation. This method uses a small offset for numerical stability (epsilon=1e-15) when the value is zero.
      Returns:
      A new Value instance representing the natural logarithm of this value.

    • sigmoid

      public Value sigmoid()
      Applies the sigmoid activation function to this value, supporting automatic differentiation. Sigmoid function outputs 1 / (1 + exp(-input)).
      Returns:
      A new Value instance representing the result of the sigmoid function.

    • exp

      public Value exp()
      Calculates the exponential of the current Value object. This method performs the exponential operation on the value field of the current Value object, creates a new Value object with the result, and sets up the backpropagation function for gradient computation if required. If requires_grad is true for the current object, the new Value object will have this object as its parent in the computation graph. This relationship is used to propagate gradients back to this object during the backpropagation phase of training.
      Returns:
      A new Value object whose value is set to the exponential of this object's value. The returned object will have its gradient computation and backpropagation settings configured based on the requires_grad status of the current object.

    • backward

      public void backward()
      Triggers the backward pass from this Value through the computational graph to compute gradients.
      Specified by:
      backward in class Differentiable
